name: Min. Eff. Res. Elec. HVAC (FS) CC
_description: Represents switch to electric residential HVAC technologies with efficiency levels determined by a sales-weighted average of the efficiencies/costs of typical electric residential HVAC technologies currently (or soon to be) on the market, from AEO 2023

market_entry_year_source.notes: Assume historical penetration is captured in baseline

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Sales-weighted combinations in 2023 of heating and cooling efficiencies (COP) for typical ASHPs (4.48 cool/2.52 heat), GSHPs (5 cool/3.6 heat), and electric resistance + central AC (4.43 cool/1 heat). New/replacement sales numbers drawn from AEO 2023 microdata files (~43% resistance/~53% ASHP/~4% GSHP), available from EIA upon request. Additional performance impacts for this measure relative to the typical electric equipment are accounted for via the savings shape data in `tsv_features`.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

installed_cost_source.notes: Sales-weighted combinations of heating installed costs for typical 2022 or 2023 ASHPs, GSHPs, and electric resistance + central AC. New/replacement sales numbers drawn from AEO 2023 microdata files, available from EIA upon request. For existing buildings, added costs of $6300 are the average of the cost range for circuit breaker panel upgrade and home service upgrade costs in the NV5 report, a new circuit cost of 700 $2022 using the upper bound (assuming a high amperage 240V circuit is required for the HVAC system) from the NV5 report, and additional tank removal costs of 800 2014$ (975 2022$) are applied for distillate and propane based on the 2015 EIA report, updating the cost from April 2014 to April 2022.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
Grid-Interactive Efficient Building Technology Cost, Performance, and Lifetime Characteristics
source_data.author: Nubbe et al.

source_data.title: Residential End Uses: Area 2: Incremental Installed Costs for Efficiency Upgrades
Service Upgrades for Electrification Retrofits Study Final Report
source_data.author: Shoshana Pena, Collin Smith, Greg Butsko, Rick Gardner, Sean Armstrong, Emily Higbee, Dylan Anderson, Rebecca Hueckel

product_lifetime_source.notes: Sales-weighted combinations of heating and cooling lifetime for typical 2022 or 2023 ASHPs, GSHPs, and electric resistance + central AC. New/replacement sales numbers drawn from AEO 2023 microdata files, available from EIA upon request.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

market_scaling_fractions_source.heating: Applies to all residential fuel-fired heating; no electric heating is switched by this ECM

cooling.title: RECS 2020 Microdata
cooling.fraction_derivation: Central AC multiple of 68% was determined as a proportion of total homes with a ducted cooling system where heating is done using any non-electric heating energy source. Total homes with ducted cooling (main air conditioning equipment type = central AC = 1) in the sample is 12,211 homes, and then filtered for homes with non-electric heating system (Main space heating fuel != electricity = 5) 12,211-3,949 homes.
